answers.answer: Braxton contractions can be a *****. Sometimes you can be having real contractions but adrenaline from stress can make them stop. If you can't  continue to talk through the contractions then definately head in.
L&D kept sending my cousin home with the same excuses, she ended up giving birth in her hallway with the help of the fire dept
Im having the same problem. Im 40w 1d and was there last night with big contractions every ten mins and smaller ones in between, and they sent me home
If it's possible go to a different hospital or L&D center. Most doctors/midwives have more than one place they have privileges at.

sometimes in the hospital they dont know what there doing trust i had my baby on mothers day i had gone to labor and delivery on friday and saturday and told me that everything was fine i went because i new for shure my water broke and they said no when i went on saturday late night they told me it was that i didnt have anymore water and had fever and baby heart was going down doctor was surprise that it was that anyways just check urself go to the er as many times u think somethings wrong ....

Jrob that is what I am afraid of. I don't want to deliver this baby at home. I'd go to a different hospital but this is the only one within 30 miles. They treat me like I'm a ftm or like I'm some little kid who doesn't know any better. I'm 36 and prego with my 2nd baby. Its just irritating

I would suggest that you use the ER sparingly. My cousin would go to the ER for every little thing because her head hurt, because she felt nauseous, because her back hurt and so on. By the time that something actually was wrong with her the ER didn't take her seriously cuz she had been in there so many times and she ended up having preeclampsia and having an emergency c-section. I think some women exaggerate and don't understand that it could actually backfire like in my cousin situation.
Don't blame the nurse or the hospital. It is your doctor that makes the decisions, your nurse just follows through with them. So maybe have a discussion with your OB.

With my second pregnancy I went into labor and  I went to the hospital and I was suppose to be having a c section so there was no point in me being in labor but the on call ob wouldn't let me have her I had to wait 3 painful days to see my regular ob who was like oh you are in labor we will take her tonight. So every ob is different. Good luck

question: I went to l &d last night BC I was having contractions. By my calc they were 4-5 minutes apart and hurt like he$$. They put me on the monitor and sure enough they were 3-5 min apart. The ob nurse told me they were not real contractions because I'm only 34+2. She proceeded to check me and I'm now 1 cm dilated and 30% effaced. I was just seen Tues for my normal appt and was almost a 1 and 0%.I layer there in pain for 2 hours still having contractions and she checked me again no change so she told me I was just dehydrated and told me to drink 1/2 gallon of water and go home n go to bed.I'm so frustrated with the ob dept cuz I've been up there so much with contractions and there's always done excuse. Ligament pains growing pain dehydrated etc. I'm to the point Idk if I will want to go there if I'm really in labor for fear that they just gonna give me an excuse and send me home
title: not a question more of a rant
